## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've got a question about creating currencies in Verus. What is a limitation of creating a currency from an ID in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
One limitation of creating a currency from an ID in Verus is that you cannot make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. This is because using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. Does that make sense? Do you have any more questions about creating currencies in Verus?

**User:**
That's a good point. Why is it not recommended to make an ID with an i-address as its name in Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
It is not recommended to make an ID with an i-address as its name in Verus because it can cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used, and it will not be supported for creating currencies. This is to reduce potential user confusion. It's better to keep things clear and avoid any potential issues. Do you have any more questions about IDs or i-addresses in Verus?

**User:**
No, that makes sense. I do have a question about creating a PBaaS chain in the Verus GUI, though. What is a limitation of creating a PBaaS chain in the Verus GUI?

**AI Assistant:**
In the Verus GUI, if a currency is already supported, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata and will not be a limitation in future releases. We're always working to improve the GUI and make it more user-friendly. Do you have any more questions about creating PBaaS chains or the Verus GUI?

**User:**
One last question. What kind of software is Verus, and what are the implications of using it?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus is experimental and unfinished software. This means that it should be used at your own risk, and there is no warranty for any kind of damage that may occur. However, the software is open-source and can be freely used, modified, and distributed, as long as the copyright notice and permission notice are included. We're still developing and improving Verus, but we're excited about its potential. Do you have any more questions about Verus or its development?
What is a limitation of creating a currency from an ID in Verus?

One limitation of creating a currency from an ID in Verus is that you cannot make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. This is because using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration.

### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.# DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. Use at your own risk!
